{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3535711,"name":"Gal Timor","username":"GalTi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galti/{size}/249769_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-21T20:36:29.244Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

Our team is working on integrating our climbing mechanism, and we need some advice on the best way to attach it to our robot.

Right now, we have two possible attachment points:

The side of the main chassis
The bottom, where we have a polycarbonate plate. We were considering adding a bar from the bottom to reinforce it.
We are concerned about the amount of torque the climbing mechanism will produce. We’re worried that if it’s not mounted properly, it could bend or damage the robot. Has anyone dealt with a similar issue? What mounting methods or reinforcements would you recommend to handle the forces from climbing?

Any advice or examples would be greatly appreciated!
